trans-unit.source: Configures and initializes a K-means clustering model
trans-unit.target: Configures and initializes a K-means clustering model

trans-unit.source: You can use the <ui>K-Means Clustering</ui> module to create an untrained K-means clustering model.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <ui>K-Means Clustering</ui> module to create an untrained K-means clustering model.

trans-unit.source: After you have configured the parameters of the K-means clustering algorithm, you pass the untrained model to the <ui>K-Means Clustering</ui> module to train the model on a set of input data that you provide.
trans-unit.target: After you have configured the parameters of the K-means clustering algorithm, you pass the untrained model to the <ui>K-Means Clustering</ui> module to train the model on a set of input data that you provide.

trans-unit.source: The K-means clustering algorithm is an unsupervised learning method, so the training dataset does not require a label column.
trans-unit.target: The K-means clustering algorithm is an unsupervised learning method, so the training dataset does not require a label column.

trans-unit.source: K-means is a popular clustering algorithm.
trans-unit.target: K-means is a popular clustering algorithm.

trans-unit.source: In general, clustering uses iterative techniques to group cases in a dataset into clusters that contain similar characteristics.
trans-unit.target: In general, clustering uses iterative techniques to group cases in a dataset into clusters that contain similar characteristics.

trans-unit.source: These groupings are useful for exploring data, identifying anomalies in the data, and creating predictions.
trans-unit.target: These groupings are useful for exploring data, identifying anomalies in the data, and creating predictions.

trans-unit.source: Clustering models also can help you identify relationships in a dataset that you might not logically derive through casual observation.
trans-unit.target: Clustering models also can help you identify relationships in a dataset that you might not logically derive through casual observation.

trans-unit.source: For this reasons, clustering is often used in the early phases of machine learning task to explore the data and discover unexpected correlations.
trans-unit.target: For this reasons, clustering is often used in the early phases of machine learning task to explore the data and discover unexpected correlations.

trans-unit.source: In the k-means method, you specify a target number of <newTerm>centroids</newTerm> (the mean points that are representative of each cluster.
trans-unit.target: In the k-means method, you specify a target number of <newTerm>centroids</newTerm> (the mean points that are representative of each cluster.

trans-unit.source: The K-means algorithm places data points into the specified number of clusters by minimizing the within-cluster sum of squares.
trans-unit.target: The K-means algorithm places data points into the specified number of clusters by minimizing the within-cluster sum of squares.

trans-unit.source: The K-means algorithm begins with an initial set of centroids, which are like central starting points for each cluster, and then uses Lloyd's algorithm to iteratively refine the locations of the centroids.
trans-unit.target: The K-means algorithm begins with an initial set of centroids, which are like central starting points for each cluster, and then uses Lloyd's algorithm to iteratively refine the locations of the centroids.

trans-unit.source: The algorithm stops building and refining clusters when it meets one or more of these conditions:
trans-unit.target: The algorithm stops building and refining clusters when it meets one or more of these conditions:

trans-unit.source: The centroids stabilize, meaning that cluster assignments for individual points no longer change and therefore the algorithm has converged on a solution.
trans-unit.target: The centroids stabilize, meaning that cluster assignments for individual points no longer change and therefore the algorithm has converged on a solution.

trans-unit.source: The algorithm completed running the specified number of iterations.
trans-unit.target: The algorithm completed running the specified number of iterations.

trans-unit.source: When you create predictions from a clustering model, the <link xlink:href="eed3ee76-e8aa-46e6-907c-9ca767f5c114" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Assign to Clusters</link> module computes the distance to the mean of each cluster, and new cases belong to the cluster with the closest mean.
trans-unit.target: When you create predictions from a clustering model, the <link xlink:href="eed3ee76-e8aa-46e6-907c-9ca767f5c114" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Assign to Clusters</link> module computes the distance to the mean of each cluster, and new cases belong to the cluster with the closest mean.

trans-unit.source: For examples of how K-means clustering is used in Azure Machine Learning, see these experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:
trans-unit.target: For examples of how K-means clustering is used in Azure Machine Learning, see these experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>Color Quantization sample</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525272</linkUri></externalLink> builds multiple K-means models with different parameters to find the optimum image compression.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>Color Quantization sample</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525272</linkUri></externalLink> builds multiple K-means models with different parameters to find the optimum image compression.

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>Clustering: Similar Companies</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525164</linkUri></externalLink> sample uses K-means with different numbers of centroids to find groups of similar companies in the S&P500.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>Clustering: Similar Companies</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525164</linkUri></externalLink> sample uses K-means with different numbers of centroids to find groups of similar companies in the S&P500.

trans-unit.source: You can modify the way that the algorithm creates and refines clusters by using the following parameters:
trans-unit.target: You can modify the way that the algorithm creates and refines clusters by using the following parameters:

trans-unit.source: It is possible that any given configuration will result in a locally optimum cluster configuration that suits only the current data points and is not generalizable.
trans-unit.target: It is possible that any given configuration will result in a locally optimum cluster configuration that suits only the current data points and is not generalizable.

trans-unit.source: If you used a different initial configuration, the K-means method might find a different, perhaps superior, configuration.
trans-unit.target: If you used a different initial configuration, the K-means method might find a different, perhaps superior, configuration.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, you should always experiment with these parameters and compare the resulting models.
trans-unit.target: Therefore, you should always experiment with these parameters and compare the resulting models.

trans-unit.source: Type the number of clusters you want the algorithm to begin with.
trans-unit.target: Type the number of clusters you want the algorithm to begin with.

trans-unit.source: This does not necessarily define the number of clusters in the final model.
trans-unit.target: This does not necessarily define the number of clusters in the final model.

trans-unit.source: Choose the function to use when measuring the distance between cluster vectors.
trans-unit.target: Choose the function to use when measuring the distance between cluster vectors.

trans-unit.source: Azure Machine Learning supports the following metrics:
trans-unit.target: Azure Machine Learning supports the following metrics:

trans-unit.source: The Euclidean distance is commonly used as a measure of cluster scatter for K-means clustering.
trans-unit.target: The Euclidean distance is commonly used as a measure of cluster scatter for K-means clustering.

trans-unit.source: This metric is preferred because it minimizes the mean distance between points and the centroids.
trans-unit.target: This metric is preferred because it minimizes the mean distance between points and the centroids.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, you can use the cosine function to measure cluster similarity.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, you can use the cosine function to measure cluster similarity.

trans-unit.source: Cosine similarity is useful in cases where you do not care about the length of a vector, only its angle,
trans-unit.target: Cosine similarity is useful in cases where you do not care about the length of a vector, only its angle,

trans-unit.source: Choose the algorithm that is used to define the initial cluster configuration.
trans-unit.target: Choose the algorithm that is used to define the initial cluster configuration.

trans-unit.source: Some initial number of data points are chosen from the data set and used as the initial means.
trans-unit.target: Some initial number of data points are chosen from the data set and used as the initial means.

trans-unit.source: The algorithm randomly places a data point in a cluster and then computes the initial mean to be the centroid of the cluster's randomly assigned points.
trans-unit.target: The algorithm randomly places a data point in a cluster and then computes the initial mean to be the centroid of the cluster's randomly assigned points.

trans-unit.source: K-means++ improves upon K-means by using a better method for choosing the initial cluster centers
trans-unit.target: K-means++ improves upon K-means by using a better method for choosing the initial cluster centers

trans-unit.source: The K-means ++ algorithm was proposed in 2007 by David Arthur and Sergei Vassilvitskii to avoid poor clustering by the standard k-means algorithm.
trans-unit.target: The K-means ++ algorithm was proposed in 2007 by David Arthur and Sergei Vassilvitskii to avoid poor clustering by the standard k-means algorithm.

trans-unit.source: A variant of the K-means++ algorithm optimized for faster clustering.
trans-unit.target: A variant of the K-means++ algorithm optimized for faster clustering.

trans-unit.source: Centroids are located equidistant from each other in the D-Dimensional space of N data points.
trans-unit.target: Centroids are located equidistant from each other in the D-Dimensional space of N data points.

trans-unit.source: If you leave this parameter blank, the module will generate points using the <legacyItalic><ui>K-Means++</ui></legacyItalic> method.
trans-unit.target: If you leave this parameter blank, the module will generate points using the <legacyItalic><ui>K-Means++</ui></legacyItalic> method.

trans-unit.source: Type the number of times for the algorithm to iterate over the training data before finalizing the selection of centroids.
trans-unit.target: Type the number of times for the algorithm to iterate over the training data before finalizing the selection of centroids.

trans-unit.source: You can adjust this parameter to balance accuracy vs. training time.
trans-unit.target: You can adjust this parameter to balance accuracy vs. training time.

trans-unit.source: Given a specific number of clusters (<legacyItalic>K</legacyItalic>) to find for a set of <legacyItalic>D</legacyItalic>-dimensional data points with <legacyItalic>N</legacyItalic> data points, the K-means algorithm builds the clusters as follows:
trans-unit.target: Given a specific number of clusters (<legacyItalic>K</legacyItalic>) to find for a set of <legacyItalic>D</legacyItalic>-dimensional data points with <legacyItalic>N</legacyItalic> data points, the K-means algorithm builds the clusters as follows:

trans-unit.source: The module initializes a <legacyItalic>K</legacyItalic>-by-<legacyItalic>D</legacyItalic> array with the final centroids that define the <legacyItalic>K</legacyItalic> clusters found.
trans-unit.target: The module initializes a <legacyItalic>K</legacyItalic>-by-<legacyItalic>D</legacyItalic> array with the final centroids that define the <legacyItalic>K</legacyItalic> clusters found.

trans-unit.source: The module assigns the first <legacyItalic>K</legacyItalic> data points in order to the <legacyItalic>K</legacyItalic> clusters.
trans-unit.target: The module assigns the first <legacyItalic>K</legacyItalic> data points in order to the <legacyItalic>K</legacyItalic> clusters.

trans-unit.source: Starting with an initial set of <legacyItalic>K</legacyItalic> centroids, the method uses Lloyd's algorithm to iteratively refine the locations of the centroids.
trans-unit.target: Starting with an initial set of <legacyItalic>K</legacyItalic> centroids, the method uses Lloyd's algorithm to iteratively refine the locations of the centroids.

trans-unit.source: The algorithm terminates when the centroids stabilize or when a specified number of iterations are completed.
trans-unit.target: The algorithm terminates when the centroids stabilize or when a specified number of iterations are completed.

trans-unit.source: A similarity metric (by default, Euclidean distance) is used to assign each data point to the cluster that has the closest centroid.
trans-unit.target: A similarity metric (by default, Euclidean distance) is used to assign each data point to the cluster that has the closest centroid.

trans-unit.source: For a list of all exceptions, see <link xlink:href="38cc86bd-4223-4e8b-b23e-4d4fbf3a5620" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Module Error Codes</link>.
trans-unit.target: For a list of all exceptions, see <link xlink:href="38cc86bd-4223-4e8b-b23e-4d4fbf3a5620" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Module Error Codes</link>.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if one or more of inputs are null or empty.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if one or more of inputs are null or empty.
